prompt: <description>**Part 1: A cylindrical object with a tapered top and a flat bottom** Begin by creating a new coordinate system, aligned with the given Euler angles (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) and translation vector (0.0, 0.0, 0.375). In the XY-plane defined by this coordinate system, create a new sketch. This sketch contains one face (face\\_1), which holds one loop (loop\\_1). Loop\\_1 consists of two curves: 1. A line (line\\_1) with a start point at (0.0, 0.0) and end point at (0.75, 0.0) 2. An arc (arc\\_1) that starts at (0.75, 0.0), transitions through a midpoint at (0.375, 0.375), and ends at (0.0, 0.0). This loop forms a closed shape; the start and end of the line connect with the end of the arc, making it a continuous shape. Scale the sketch with the given scaling factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch, utilizing the provided euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the sketch vertically, creating a 3D part: - Extrude_depth\\_towards\\_normal: 0.1875 - Extrude_depth_opposite_normal: 0.1875 The description provides the following dimensions for this part: length 0.75, width 0.75, height 0.375. **Part 2: A cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom resembling a metallic tube.** Create a new coordinate system, set to the provided Euler angles (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) and translation vector (0.3044, 0.1169, 0.75). Draw a fresh sketch on the XY-plane defined by this coordinate system. This sketch contains one face (face\\_1) and one loop (loop\\_1). The loop consists solely of a circle (circle\\_1). The circle's center is set at (0.0706, 0.0706) with a radius of 0.0706. Do not scale the sketch in this case. Turn the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch, using the provided coordinate system's euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the circle based on the following details: - Extrude_depth_towards_normal: 0 - Extrude_depth_opposite_normal: 0.2812 The description for this part is: shape: "A cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom, resembling a metallic tube," length: 0.1412, width: 0.1412, height: 0.2812. The final shape is a 3-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, its sides being parallel and perpendicular to one another. Its dimensions are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units.</description>

To create the 3D model, extrude the 2D sketch along the normal vector by a depth of 0.5 units in the positive direction, and a depth of 0 in the negative direction. The sketch scale is 0.75. This will create the slightly tapered top and bottom of the prism. The final dimensions of the prism are as follows: - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.5 units - Height: 0.75 units</description>
